144 
145 // Describable stream manipulator state class
146 //
147 // This is not a class that a user needs to see and that is why it is not
148 // being given doxygen documentation!
149 struct DescribableStreamManipulatorState {
150  const Describable &describable;
151  const EVerbosityLevel verbLevel;
152  DescribableStreamManipulatorState(
153  const Describable &_describable,
154  const EVerbosityLevel _verbLevel = VERB_MEDIUM
155  )
156  :describable(_describable)
157  ,verbLevel(_verbLevel)
158  {}
159 };
160 
161 
183 inline DescribableStreamManipulatorState describe(
184  const Describable &describable,
185  const EVerbosityLevel verbLevel = Describable::verbLevel_default
186  )
187 {
188  return DescribableStreamManipulatorState(describable,verbLevel);
189 }
190 
191 
218 inline
219 std::ostream& operator<<(
220  std::ostream& os, const DescribableStreamManipulatorState& d
221  )
222 {
223  d.describable.describe(*getFancyOStream(Teuchos::rcp(&os,false)),d.verbLevel);
224  return os;
225 }
226 
227 //
228 // RAB: Note: The above function works with an std::ostream object even
229 // through Describable::describe(...) requires a FancyOStream object. We must
230 // write the stream manipulator in terms of std::ostream, or compound output
231 // statements like:
232 //
233 // void foo( FancyOStream &out, Describable &d, EVerbLevel verbLevel )
234 // {
235 // out << "\nThis is the describable object d:" << describe(d,verbLevel);
236 // }
237 //
238 // will not work correctly. The problem is that the first output
239 //
240 // out << "\nThis is the describable object d:"
241 //
242 // must return a reference to an std::ostream object. This should mean that
243 // the next statement, which is basically:
244 //
245 // static_cast<std::ostream&>(out) << DescribableStreamManipulatorState
246 //
247 // should not even compile. However, under gcc 3.4.3, the code did compile
248 // but did not call the above function. Instead, it set up some type of
249 // infinite recursion that resulted in a segfault due to the presence of the
250 // Teuchos::any class!
251 //
252 
253 
254 } // namespace Teuchos
255 
256 #endif // TEUCHOS_DESCRIBABLE_HPP

The Teuchos namespace contains all of the classes, structs and enums used by Teuchos, as well as a number of utility routines.
